intro: Maytenus inflata, commonly known as the inflated mayten, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated fruit that resembles a small balloon. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and greenish-white, clustered in inflorescences, and the plant is adapted to a variety of soil types in its native habitat.
